Situation1: They share their work challenges and personal concerns after noticing their spouse seems worried.
Expectation2: Perform maintenance and cleaning of the machines to ensure optimal performance
Situation2: A critical bearing is screeching loudly and threatening an immediate breakdown.
Story: I stood in the kitchen, wiping my hands on a towel, my mind still replaying the shrill screech of the bearing from the factory floor. The maintenance log flashed in my memory—overdue, and now the machine was threatening to seize up at any moment. I knew if I didn’t get back soon, production would grind to a halt, and the blame would land squarely on my shoulders. But as I turned to leave, I caught sight of my husband at the table, his brow furrowed, eyes distant. He’d been quiet all evening, and I remembered my promise to be more open, to share and listen when either of us was troubled. He looked up, as if about to speak, and I felt the weight of both worlds pressing in. My phone buzzed with a message from work—urgent, come now. My heart pounded, torn between the screeching machine and the silent plea in my husband’s eyes, each demanding a part of me I wasn’t sure I could give.
